CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 11, 1961, pg. 10, reads: "Seeking Jobs At Kroger's - Officers and members of the Greater Pittsburgh Improvement League (GPIL), upset because of the lack of Negro workers in Kroger Stores in Pittsburgh, last week picketed the Kroger Centre Avenue Store in Oakland. Among those in  the line were, left to right: Billy Robertson; Melvin Garth...The GPIL reported that picketing will resume this week if there's no settlement. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Greater Pittsburgh Improvement League (GPIL) members William "Billy" Roberson and Melvin Garth holding signs reading "Please! Do Not Patronize Kroger's...we want employment...buy rights by buying right," protesting in front of Kroger Grocery Store, Oakland
